data.title: Susan Agnes (Bernard) Macdonald (1836-1920)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Agnes (Bernard) Macdonald born 1836 Spanish Town, Jamaica died 1920 Eastbourne, Sussex, England, United Kingdom including parents + children + 1 photos + 1 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Profile last modified 3 Dec 2023 | Created 18 Nov 2009

This page has been accessed 2,570 times.

Biography

Lady Agnes Macdonald was the second wife of Sir John A. Macdonald, Canada's first prime minister. She was a talented writer, who in addition to her diaries, published travel and political sketches.[1]

Agnes, born in 1836 in Jamaica, was the daughter of Thomas Bernard, a plantation owner and member of Jamaica's Privy Council, and Theodora Hewitt. [2][3] After her father's death in 1850, the family emigrated to Canada. Her brother Hewitt became John A. Macdonald's private secretary when Macdonald was attorney general of Canada West. But it wasn't until 1867 that Agnes married Macdonald after a chance encounter in London, England, where she and her mother were living with family.[4][5]

Lady Macdonald's obituary was published on on 8 September 1920 in London, Greater London, England. She died (age 84) on 5 September 1920 in Eastbourne.[6]

Susan Agnes Macdonald of Earnscliffe died in Eastbourne, Sussex, England and their estate passed probate on 12 October 1921 in London, England.[7]

Sources

↑ The Canadian Encyclopedia [1]

↑ "Jamaica Births and Baptisms, 1752-1920," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:XNJH-B5P : accessed 18 August 2015), Susan Agnes Bernard, ; citing Jamaica, reference v3A,it1,p306,#154; FHL microfilm 1,291,712.

↑ Creighton, Donald. John A. Macdonald. Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 1998, p. 455. Google e-Book
